solution_line_template: To know how many groups of {cans_per_group} cans there are in {total_cans_to_fill} cans, we calculate {total_cans_to_fill} / {cans_per_group} = <<{total_cans_to_fill}/{cans_per_group}={num_groups}>>{num_groups}.
For each of these groups, {minutes_per_group} minutes are needed, so it takes {minutes_per_group} * {num_groups} = <<{minutes_per_group}*{num_groups}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes.
